data.title: Lawrence, Ernest Orlando, 1901
data.text:
Ernest Orlando Lawrence

Dates

August 8, 1901 – August 27, 1958

Authorized Form of Name

Lawrence, Ernest Orlando, 1901-1958

Additional Forms of Names

Lawrence, E. O. (Ernest Orlando), 1901-1958

Biography

Abstract

Ernest Orlando Lawrence was Director of the University of California Radiation Laboratory, Berkeley (1936-1958). Other institutional affiliations included Yale University. His research interests included the cyclotron and atomic energy.

August 8, 1901Birth, Canton (S.D.).

1918 – 1919Took undergraduate courses, St. Olaf College, Northfield (Minn.).

1922Obtained BA, University of South Dakota, Vermillion (S.D.).

1923Obtained MA, University of Minnesota, Minneapolis (Minn.).

1923 – 1924Worked towards PhD in Physics, University of Chicago, Chicago (Ill.).

1925Obtained PhD in Physics, Yale University, New Haven (Conn.).

1925 – 1928National Research Fellow (1925-1927) and Assistant Professor of Physics (1927-1928), Yale University.

1928 – 1958Associate Professor of Physics (1928-1930); Professor of Physics (1930-1958); and Director, Radiation Laboratory (1936-1958), University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley (Calif.).

1934Member, National Academy of Sciences.

1937Member, American Philosophical Society.

1939Awarded Nobel Prize in Physics "for the invention and development of the cyclotron and for results obtained with it, especially with regard to artificial radioactive elements".

1941Member, Advisory Committee on Uranium Research, National Academy of Sciences.

1941 – 1946Program Chief, S-1 Uranium Section (1941-1942) and Member, Executive Committee, S-1 Uranium Section (1942-1946), Office of Scientific Research and Development.

1942 – 1945Scientific Adviser and Project Director, Berkeley Radiation Laboratory, Manhattan Project, Berkeley (Calif.).

1956 – 1958Member, Board of Trustees, RAND Corporation.

1957Awarded Enrico Fermi Award, United States Atomic Energy Commission.

August 27, 1958Death, Palo Alto (Calif.).

Occupation

Nuclear physicist.
